They are rude. Like I asked if I could get my appointment for the morning.   She said I can request it but not guarantee it. I said of course not because we are at your mercy!  If I could give this place a 0 star I would. It sucks DO NOT USE THEM THEY SUCK!

name: Rebekah Weinberger
text: Very helpful and knowledgeable. Were in and out in under 30 minutes!

name: Chelsie Braden
text: This has to be the worst experience I have ever had with a repair company. We bought the extended warranty on our washer and dryer thinking that it was a good idea just in case anything went wrong with them. Well, our washer started giving us a lot of problems and would not stop spinning or drain any water. We called the warranty company and they told us a technician from this company would come out and check our washer. The tech came out and looked at the washer less than 10 minutes and during that time was beyond rude to me. He did not do anything to the washer and just said that he would not be able to come back for another week. He needed to order parts. Well, the day came when someone was supposed to come back to fix our machine and they called us and told us that the repairman called in sick and it would not be til Monday if at all. It is beyond ridiculous what this company has put us through. I would never recommend them to anyone.

name: alex craft
text: Ray did a great, expedient job. Very professional!

name: Howard Dolgoff
text: Axxton is incredible! Fixed my dishwasher flawlessly!

name: James Mulready
text: I bought a new Magtag washer . Found the tub not spinning out water . Lowes sent S&S out to diagnose . Ordered parts, one week later. Part came in they replaced . Machine working like supposed to. Brand new doesnt mean anything . But good service does . S&S did exactly what they said and were very polite.  Hard to find these days . Imagine that someone keeping their promise.  They are great in my eyes

name: Vercingtorix Wilson
text: Knowledgeable staff , prices a little elevated

name: botcwc1
text: Very unorganized. It has been over two months and we still not have not had our appliances fixed. They call and cancel or no-show and then when someone finally shows up has no clue what's going on. Hard to believe that this is the best the Birmingham has to offer I'm sure there are better businesses out there to to send your business too.save the frustration and use a reputable appliance dealer

name: CINDY Sandidge
text: Doug the service technician was a life saver for me. He definitely fixed my washer. I initially had Roberts Appliance sent to my house all they did was clear out some codes and said nothing was wrong. They came back out and have to call technical support amd they were having issues ao the guy left and said he wasnt coming back. But Doug went the extra step and got it fixed for me. I will definitely be recommending this place. Thank you Doug

name: Andrew Kallus
text: Can I give no stars?  Their website says you can schedule a service within two days, it took us weeks before someone was able to come out.  I own a WhirlPool front loading washing machine and the bearing is slowly fading and it makes a lot of noise.  It's loud but it works.  Today, I was told someone will show up between 8am and 12pm.  He did not show up until 2pm.  During the next hour, he disassembled the washing machine.  After about an hour, he told me that headquarters needed him to finish his other jobs, so he left my washing machine disassembled and started his next jobs.  About 530pm he called and said he had one more stop and then will be over.  At 645PM he called again saying he will come back but only to put the washing machine back together.  Around this time I was hungry and went to get food where I noticed he did not turn off the water and it had slowly leaked on the floor.  I cleaned this up and turned off the nozzle.  When he finally returned, he did not clean up any of the water on the floor and started to put the washing machine back together.  Once it was back together, he told me it will work just like it did before where it worked but was noisy.  So once he left, I started a load of wet towels, which I used to clean up the floor.  During the first 30 seconds, while I was gone getting a fan to help dry the floor, I heard what can only be described as a waterfall.  The front of the washing machine was leaking water profusely.  I quickly turned it off. Needless to say that I waited weeks for them to come repair a working washing machine for them to flood my floor and make the washing machine unusable.  Not only that I missed a day of work waiting for 12 hours when if they just did not come it would have been all the same and possibly better.  Throughout this experience, I did not feel like a customer getting any type of good treatment.  He left to do other jobs without even finishing mine and then ends up breaking it.

name: Michelle Fuller
text: Cliff from S&S was very friendly and professional. Highly would recommend.

name: Jameshia Stovall
text:
2/15/2018 they came to my house in Montgomery and when the employee got here. He didn’t even have the part when he got here for my washing machine. Before he left my home he claimed he was going to order the part. And he will return on this Thursday but I was contacted today by the company telling me that the warranty was not approved yet after he had already told me he had ordered the part. Whirlpool needs to revaluate their contract. If my washing machine is not repair by next I will be contacting the attorney Generals office.
AVOID THIS COMPANY AT ALL COST !!! Ridiculous and sad

name: Tim Humphries
text: They’re great with help at the counter, but be warned on the service call!! I had a dryer not heating correctly and while they did fix it, it cost half of what the dryer cost. They will charge a $89 service charge to diagnose the problem. Then you get hit with a $75 labor charge (he was at my house 30-45 minutes) to put a $18 part on. I paid $200 to fix a little bit over $400 dryer. If I’d known ahead of time, I would either called someone else or bought a new one. I should have looked at the reviews first. That should tell you all you need to know.

name: Nina Cobia
text: Wonderful.  The tech had never encountered the problem I was having with the  water dispenser on my refrigerator. He called the factory and the recommended "fix" did not work.  He persevered, called some other techs  and did some trouble shooting until he fixed the problem!  Didn't take long either.  This was after Sears had come out and replaced the water valve which did NOT fix the problem. I called yesterday and he was here today.  It took Sears two weeks.  I would highly recommend. My tech was Doug Raffield and he was professional and friendly.

name: Mal Sinclair
text:
I had an appointment scheduled from 8-12pm today. I called at 12:18 pm to inform them that no one has come by yet. The man that I spoke to told me that the repair man came and waited for ‘15 minutes before leaving a note on my door’. I told him I have not left the house once today, I have been in my living room with my sick toddler. I have a 24 hour Nest video survalliance of my entire street and I can assure you he never even came to my street. He told me I rescheduled your appointment for next week I am sorry we missed you. I said you did not miss me, he is lying to you because I also had a flooring repairman at my house for an hour and a half this morning while my front door was open the entire time and your repairman made no attempt let alone left an alleged note. Instead of trying to resolve the issue he implied I was the liar and not his employee. I would be glad to e mail the video survalliance from 8-12pm!

Update: After filing a BBB complaint I received a reply that the tech did indeed go to the wrong house.

name: D Jackson
text: Doug Raffield came out to service our problem child ice maker!!!! He was great- courteous, prompt, extremely professional, and took great care us. I highly recommend this company and strongly suggest you ask for Doug.

name: Suzanne McCreedy, Esq.
text: Their technician, Randy Wilson, came out to repair a new dryer that I purchased. He was great! Randy immediately knew how to resolve the problem, and took care of it. He was very professional, friendly, and arrived when he said he would.  This was my first time using this company. I will absolutely use these folks again!

name: Asaf Stein
text:
1 star is too much. Unprofessional, disorganized, waste of time and money and patience. DO NOT under any circumstances hire these worthless morons to work on your home.

Like most people here, they came to work on my house through a home warranty. They took months to order parts, 8 or 9 no shows with no calling. Showed up late with out parts.

It’s like I hired the federal government to fix my dishwasher.

Worst experience of my life besides my root canal.

name: Tess Waters
text: They charged me a $95 service fee to come out and "look" at my washer to tell me nothing was wrong with it and said it would be an additional fee to start servicing and find the problem. I called to see what all my warranty covered and the lady I talked with told me that it was only a 5 year when everywhere else was saying 10 year warranty. When I was asking what the fee was for since he didn't do anything. Literally did absolutely nothing. She replied with a smug attitude "You don't think we come out there for free do you?" I asked for a manager and of course one wasnt available and I asked to be called back and that still hasn't happened. Absolute worst customer service I've ever had. DO NOT USE THEM!!

name: Kaitlyn York
text: I wasted $60 on a service call with this company. I explained the door would fall down and  the dishwasher was not cleaning well and the "technician" cycled it and said "everything sounds good" and told me that I was using the wrong kind of detergent and left. He was at my house for a total of 10 minutes.

name: Melissa Freeman
text: Worst company to deal with. Zero customer service. My warranty company requested this company so I'm thinking they are a reputable company.   When I made the appointment, I asked them to call me ahead of time (30 minutes to an hour) to let me know when they were coming out so I could take off work. I said if they could not do this I would take off work as I have been without a washing machine since November and going to the laundry-mat cost me about $50.00 a month. The guy that made the appointment said that would not be a problem for him to call an hour ahead of time. I had to wait two weeks just to get the appointment. I was not happy about having to wait two weeks but no problem, I will do whatever it takes.  They are in Bessemer AL, I am in Pensacola Florida. You would think sometime on the way the technician would have time to make a courtesy call to say "I'm heading your way".  I received a call when the technician was at my home. He didn't leave a message on my voicemail so I'm thinking I just received a call from an unknown caller. He called again so I called him immediately back.  The phone rang once and when straight to a recording that he does not have voicemail set up. I  automatically left work and would be at my home within 10 minutes. So while driving to my home just incase it is the technician.  I call their office. They said he just left my home. I asked if he could go back  I will be there in 10 minutes. They said I need to call my warranty company and reschedule. Then I call the unknown number back and speak to Adam. He said he called me 4 times. I said he called me twice not 4 times and I called him immediately back after the second call.  I asked if he could come back. He said his office is 71 miles away and he was already half way there. Unless this guy is flying this is not possible as all of this took place within a 20 minute time span from my phone records. I will be filing a formal complaint with my warranty company, the better business bureau and the department that issued this company a license.

name: Nicole Thompson
text: My technician has had to come out to my house several times for my oven. He is so sweet everytime! Always calls and lets me know when he is on his way. His name is Tommy Kennedy. Very fast work also!!

name: Henry Wilson
text: My experience with them. I called because an icemaker quit working. The tech came out and turned it on, listened and discovered the compressor wasn't turning on. He never tested the compressor with a meter, never even rolled the machine out from where it was sitting to look at the compressor or any other components. He told me the compressor was bad and it would cost $700 plus to repair it.  I pulled up you tube and watched a few videos on testing compressors, tested it, and it tested fine. I started testing other items until I got to the control board. When i removed it and looked at it, there was an obvious problem where a solder joint had melted away on a relay contact. I tested the relay and it was still working, so i soldered it back, put the machine back together, and it has been cranking out ice ever since. The $85 I paid these people was a complete waste and I am not confident that they know what they are doing.

name: Yvette Kittell
text: Had an appointment scheduled for today, from 8-12. Around 11:30, I called to find out where my tech was and was told by Randy that he was still on job #2. And job #3 still needed attention. I took the day off from work because they told me they would be here between 8-12. Randy made excuses for the tech not showing up on time and didn't offer a solution. Don't call whirlpool and schedule your repairs with them because that's who they will contact. And maybe I got bad service because I live in the South and people in these parts don't like to work and know nothing about customer service.

name: Stephanie Edwards
text: I wish I could leave ZERO stars. This company does NOT care about its customers. S&S came out on a Whirlpool Warranty call (which is probably the reason they didn't care too much to begin with). This was his THIRD time out. I confirmed via email the day before for the 12-5 time slot. He had the address and all codes he needed. He called me at 12:59pm saying if he didn't get a call back within 10 minutes he was moving on. I was in a work meeting. Why don't they call 30 minutes out when they're on the way like other companies? Why did he need me to call him back after I already confirmed I'd be there the day before? Called customer service and they refused to help me, saying I should have just answered the phone. They just wanted to reschedule- for a FOURTH time. Unacceptable.

name: Mary Hendry
text: I have had a HORRIFIC experience trying to get a service from a PAID for extended warranty and I am in coverage. name: Daniel Marchand
text:
I wouldn't use this company again. I have a Bosch Dishwasher that had an issue under manufacture warranty and unfortunately the closest authorized Bosch repair vendors was this one (who has an auxiliary service center in Huntsville), and another company in Birmingham (The Birmingham place seemed very nice on the phone, but I didn't want to wait a couple weeks for a tech to fix it... so I called S&S).

First off after calling the other repair place in Birmingham, I found the lady on the phone at S&S very rushy - just wanted name, address, payment method got me off the phone quick... the other repair place took down all my info, make/model, serial #, everything and was going to preorder potential parts so they could do one visit and be done. Dispite my initial impression of calling S&S I went with them anyway since they could come out in 2-3 days vice 1-2 weeks. (when your used to having a dishwasher it's not fun when it's broken...)

So the first guy comes out, looks at the dishwasher, deems we need a new sump pump, leaves. 2nd visit he comes by installs the new part does a really quick test and deems its fixed and leaves.  My wife goes to run the dishwasher on a full cycle and the draining error code comes up again.

I called the company and was informed someone was coming out the next day to check it. This time we get a guy who didn't even know how to spell Bosch (OK I'm exagerating, but in his words he never seen this kind of dishwasher... had no clue how to work it, fix it, nothing...), treated my wife horribley, he had to call Bosch to walk him through troubleshooting, then proceeds to berate my wife saying it's our plumbing get a plumber the dishwasher is fine, and threatens to charge us if we call for warranty purposes again since it is our plumbing.

Just to give this jerk the benefit of the doubt I took apart the piping under my sink and found no blockages (cleaned it a bit anyway), the sink the dishwasher was hooked to for drainage has never had issues... as far as the intall it was professionally installed by Lowe's and has worked flawless for 11 months so how the heck can it be my plumbing?

After fooling with it more myself I found out when the 1st guy replaced our pump it ajared the door that covers the sump pump from the inside of the dishwasher, and some food was caught in there. After I cleaned it and reseated the door correctly it worked fine again...

In summary my experience: Curt, rushy phone operator; experienced, but in a hurry repair tech (1st and 2nd visit same guy); and lastly rude and unknowledgeable repair tech (3rd visit).

Next time if I had to choose between this place and the Birmingham repair place I'll take my chances with how long it takes the Birmingham folks to come out.... I'd rather wait a week longer and have someone take the time to fix it right then some half fast job, but you know it's all about the $$ the more jobs they cram into a day the more $$ they take in so this is what you get.

resp.text:
I would like to apologize for your experience. That is certainly not typical. We are a local family business and always strive to treat everyone as we would want to be treated. As for the prices, I’ve double checked all the prices we have on refrigerator s and most of them are fairly competitive for the particular models. There was one model that was mis-priced and has been adjusted accordingly and we thank you for bringing that to our attention. Again I’m sorry for what happened in your case and hope you will give us another chance in the future.
Thanks, Josh

name: Daniella Barone
text:
Terrible experience using this “company” Everything they advertise on their website was false. I needed a repair on a GE dishwasher that they claimed was their most common brand they worked on and that the stocked their vans with parts and have same day service. None of that was true. I researched several places and decided on them based on those things.

The technician, Casey was late for the appointment, which was not that big of a deal but when he got there he hardly checked anything just pressed the buttons and looked under the appliance.....which by watching YouTube I had already done more to diagnose than he did. When he tried to explain what was wrong with it he really couldn’t because he said he didnt have the tools to diagnose the problem....? I thought that was what he was there to do? Anyway came time to pay and it was a 70 dollar service fee which I would have been fine with but he literally didn’t do anything!! He wanted to fix the problem by trial and error (because he didn’t have what was necessary to diagnose or fix it)..by buying two parts and seeing if they would fix it and by that point I could just buy a new dishwasher.

I tried to call and tell my experience with a manager and they blew me off and never called back. I told them I’d be disputing the charge because service was not rendered at all. Such terrible customer service.

If you are looking for a repair on an appliance with people who know what they are doing and good customer service....look elsewhere and don’t rely on the info from their website.

text: This has nothing to do with the repair man. He was polite and very professional. However, I was appalled having to pay $131.50 for a service that did not require a part. I am giving it up, I will only buy cheap foreign things at least I don't feel taking advantage when the darn thing brakes down. I'll just get another one. This is were you could have increased business by showing you trust your products and if repairs are required after warranty the costs are reasonable. A $131.50 without parts, in my opinion, is unreasonable. Good luck for the future, without me!

name: Hugh B
text:
Horrible!!!  The first technician showed-up to repair my GAS range with no manometer (device to measure gas pressure), then tried to guess at the problem being related to the electronic ignition system.  Then, the second technician shows-up a week later with the manometer but with no adapters to check the gas line or the regulator pressure so just guesses it's probably the regulator.  But, the regulator he orders and delivered to my house is clearly the wrong part so I have to spend hours with their non-native English speaking customer service representatives to cancel the next service call and get a UPS pickup order to return the part.

Now SEARS is fighting my credit card dispute for all the charges including the wrong part that was returned over a week ago.   No wonder the company is having so much financial difficulty.

I WILL NEVER USE SEARS EVER AGAIN!

name: RACHAEL
text:
I was supposed to have my refrigerator fixed today “ 03/23/2021.. My ice maker and water dispenser does not work... The 1st time the gentleman showed up on time to verify the temperature, model and what needed to be fixed and ordered.  I was okay with that the date was a week ago.  I called Service Care today because at this time I had not received confirmation to verify the time he was coming... There was no confirmation like email, text or no one had called to confirm.  I call the company today and Ms Chen states the parts “may” be in on the 25th of March and I explained to her that this was not explained to me she states the technician does not know when the items comes in I explained to her I don’t know his job of what information should or should not have been relayed to me I just know the date I was told the parts would be in and the date he will be back to fix it.
Of course, I requested to speak to the manager and of course the “MANAGER” is not here but I will relay the message!!!!

Please do not give a date you will fix appliances  if it can’t be done.....

IN THE FUTURE AT LEAST CALL THE CUSTOMER TO LET THEM KNOW THERE IS A DELAY OF DELIVERY OF ITEMS NEEDED SO THE CUSTOMER DOES NOT HAVE TO WAIT!!!!! STILL WAITING, NOT PLEASED AT ALL ... UNSATISFIED CUSTOMER!!!!!

I would not give this one star!!!!!

UPDATE ***03/26/2021**

I’m changing this from “1” STAR TO “4” STARS
The technician and a manager came to my home and apologized for the miscommunication... The part unfortunately would not fix my refrigerator “Ice maker and Water dispenser” because there is a shortage in the wiring and now I need a new refrigerator. Thank you

resp.text: (Part not available from manufacturer, last one found in the counry, part arrived today, scheduled for today). I apologize, the part required to fix your water dispenser is no longer available from the manufacturer, however we have diligently pursued finding this part through other sources and found the last one available online. I'm sorry about the lack of communication regarding the difficulty of finding this part. We really expected this brand to support their products better with parts availibility. Tracking number 1Z3V582E0318781474 shows that your part was received at 11:42am, and we have confirmed the part is here and good, and our tech will be coming to you in 30 minutes or less!

name: Taliesha Cash
text: I really tried to give this company the benefit of the doubt but after the 4th visit to my house and no resolve  I'm done ..out of $350 and nothing works  my ice maker quit and it was working fine before they started trying to work on my freezer leak ..the freezer is still not closing after the drawer rod and hinges were replaced so that the door would close. it was closing fine and freezing before they touched it...At this point I count it all a lost and I guess I need a new refrigerator sure wish I could have used that $350 on a new one instead of wasting it on all these wasted visits to my house..save your coins and don't call them...

resp.text:
In order to make up for a bad experience, we have offered this customer a free deluxe home appliance maintenance service call, which includes safety and preventative issue maintenance on their refrigerator, washer, dryer, dryer vent, dishwasher and oven (a $299 value).

This review was written before we refunded this customer. Sometimes a unit is too old, and has too many problems, to justify repair. We issued a refund after the customer decided to buy a new unit rather than approve further repairs. -- Initially we traced her leak to a clogged condensate drain, but she continued to have the leak. After the drain was found clogged again and cleared, it continued to leak. Further investigation found that that her drawer was not closing perfectly because of a defective gear, which was allowing moist room air into the freezer which was building up high levels of frost, which was also causing her drain to clog. When the unit defrosted, it would produce the leak called us about in the first visit. The rails to the drawer were also rusty, which interfered with proper drawer closure. In addition, she had a stuck light switch, which was unrelated to the leak problem.

Obviously won't do business with Service Care or recommend them to anyone for any reason.

text: I cannot recommend the Service Care team enough. They thoroughly earned their 5 Stars and exceeded every expectation of top notch customer service one could have. Toxey and his team did everything possible to help me find the part I needed, got it to me in a timely manner, and did so at an extremely fair cost. They put up with my 10k questions and let me pick their brain constantly on symptoms and what it might mean rather than selling me a bunch of parts that may or may not work. If you're looking for a team that will help you with your electronics and do so until the job is done, I would recommend you give them a call first. Thank you for all of your help.

resp.text:
Update: I look forward to hearing from you. Ask for Toxey at 205-956-3777. Thank you!

Wow! I’m so sorry, our hours have been changed for years, and I don’t know why the website wasn’t updated. If you’ll contact me Monday at 956-3777 I would like to hear about your experience and give you a credit towards your service for your wasted gas and time. My name is Toxey McDavid, and I am the owner. - update, I found a part sales page with Saturday hours listed. I’ve contacted our web developer and asked them to hunt these down and fix them. I hope that you’ll contact me and allow me to make this up to you. - Toxey

name: Lee Sharp
text: After waiting a week and a half for the repairman to come fix our LG refrigerator cooling issue, he came, claimed that our compressor needed replacing, and left. A week later, he came back to replace the compressor and fix the icemaker. He did and said it would cool in 24 hours. It did, so we put our food back in the refrigerator. THE NEXT MORNING, it was out again. All of our food was ruined. We had to call the actual LG repairman (which there is only ONE in the city of Birmingham). When he came, he had to AGAIN replace the compressor because the job before was so poor. He also had to replace another evaporator line because it was not working. The icemaker STILL does not work. This is STILL one of the worst experiences. After a month and a half, we finally have a cooling refrigerator, but still no icemaker.

resp.text: Lee, I'm the owner of Service Care and I apologize for your service experience. LG has more than one authorized service company, and I can assure you that we are one of them. I'm just unhappy that you're unhappy, and I would love to hear from you about your experience and do what I can to make it right for you. My company phone number is 205-956-3777, my name is Toxey McDavid, and I truly want to try to make this right.

resp.text: This review does not make any sense. -- We were paid by her extended warranty to provide service, and her extended warranty would not just abandon her to have to buy a new unit. This customer called to tell us it still had an issue after our repair (no mention of supposed damages at this time), we told her we would be happy to fix it, but she would have to call her extended warranty to send another dispatch. We never heard from them. -- Now we receive a review that implies we ruined her refrigerator and now has to buy a new one? -- This isn't how extended warranties work. We're very confused by this review, as we in no way damaged her refrigerator. We installed two parts, an icemaker and a damper... there's no way we could have damaged her unit, and no way her extended warranty would have told her she had to pay for a new unit (that's not how extended warranties work).

resp.text: Thank you! Scott is a thorough technician and really cares about helping customers. Proud to have him with Service Care.

name: Andrew Stoney
text: Scott again provided professional quality service for us. He was on time, courteous, and knowledgable. I highly reccomend Service Care and Scott for home appliance repair.

resp.text: Scott is a great technician! We appreciate the review.

name: Jean Nowell
text: Scott was our Technician and he did a great job. Thank you for such quick service.

You have a one-year warranty on the service provided, and we're always ready to come back to the Cahaba Cove neighborhood in Trussville.

name: Lydia Andrews
text: Scott did a great job, he was respectful, courteous, kind to my kids when they asked him questions,  and he was punctual.

name: JENNIFER WEST
text: We can't begin to say enough good things about ServiceCare!  They are prompt, professional, and extremely customer service oriented.  Our dryer was broken and all it took was one phone call to get them to come out and fix it.  Our technician, Fred, arrived on time, quickly determined the problem, and had it repaired within 45 minutes.  We've tried other appliance repair companies in the past and have had all kinds of problems but not with ServiceCare; they are great and we will always use them in the future.  I highly recommend them!

resp.text: Wow! Thank you for such an incredible review, Jennifer. We're so glad to hear you were satisfied with our services and that we could repair your dryer so quickly. Please let us know if you ever need help with your appliances in the future.

name: Christian Millan Salinas
text: Excellent service Thank you Fixing my Sony BRAVIA 4K Tv.

resp.text: We were more than happy to help you with your Sony TV, Christian. Thank you for your review and your business!

name: Cub Scout
text: Brian did an awesome job, he gave me a great explanation of how the fridge works and told me how to troubleshoot on my own.... really appreciate his patience and advice.

resp.text: Thank you for letting us service your Kenmore Refrigerator. We love coming to the Edgewood neighborhood, and we're proud to have Brian giving excellent service to all of Homewood!

name: Conniejones Jones
text: I was overall pleased with the repairs. I think that your staff could have kept me more informed and up to date on the progress. I had to call twice to check to see if it was ready. It was there 6 days. The other concern was the total cost of repairs were a lot more than I was expecting.   Bruce Jones.

resp.text:
I checked into this repair to see how we failed to call and let you know it was ready for six days, and what I found was that the part came in on 10/20/2016, was scheduled for tech to install part on 10/24/2016, the tech called that day when it was finished, and it was picked up on the next day. The time between completion and customer contact was less than an hour.

I can't see where we failed to provide follow up on this repair, and I'm sorry that we somehow created that perception.

name: Tamichael Marbury
text: Originally I was not pleased with the service that I received. However, when the owner calls you and lets you know how much he values your business and makes the situation right, they definitely deserve a 5-star rating. It's not the mistakes that we make, it's how we rectify them! This level of customer service does not exist anymore. I've since referred many people to them! My TV is still working great as well!

resp.text: I've spoken with Mrs. Marbury about the difficulties we've both had communicating with each other. I offered her a discount on the repair after listening to her concerns, and the repair was completed to her satisfaction. She seemed very happy, and said she would update her repair, but has not done so at this date.

name: Linda Duckworth
text: Dryer repair.  Happy with everything but the cost.   Was told it was $75 to come out which would be deducted from cost if repaired.  Problem was a collection of lint in the vent hose.  Repairman did have to go into crawl space, but no parts were required for repair.  Still had to pay a total of $160...for a ball of lint.

resp.text: Hello, it sounds like the unit was not drying, and what was needed to repair that issue was a thorough dryer vent cleaning. If you compare prices with other companies that offer dryer vent cleaning, you will find that we are comparable or better in our pricing. We consider this a repair, as the unit was not functioning before we arrived, and after we spent time working on your issue the dryer was working again. I would love to discuss this with you further, please feel free to call our office at 956-3777 and ask for Toxey. I am very interested in hearing from you about what we could do to make this 5 star service. Thank you!

name: Tony Jackson
text: Excellent service and very professional and polite! Technician was excellent and very knowledgeable!

name: Will Walsh
text:
Craig was a pleasure to have in our home.

Polite, professional, and pretty cool to deal with the unexpected situation that he walked into (squirrels in kitchen hood exhaust) with such a pleasant demeanor.

Highly recommended.

name: Scott Blanchard
text: When our Bosch in-wall microwave went on the blink, I contracted service care to do a fault diagnosis so that I could order the faulty part(s) and repair it. The technician misdiagnosed the problem as a blown fuse. Once I purchased a new fuse and replaced it (an extremely easy process), upon turning on the microwave the fuse immediately blew again. So, I was out my $85 diagnostic fee and still did not know the real issue. My first attempts to get Service Care to complete the diagnosis were unsuccessful, however, after some time, the service care owner called me and we reached a satisfactory agreement. For this reason, I would use Service Care again and can recommend them to others.

resp.text: Thank you Scott for your feedback about this experience, and for allowing us the chance to make it right. We appreciate you, and look forward to helping you in the future.

name: Ron Berry
text: Was professional and on time.  The tech knew exactly what to troubleshoot based on description of the problem.  I will use again.

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Ron! We're glad you were satisfied with your service.

name: Your name Your name
text: My LG refrigerator compressor went out. This is one of the companies LG forces you to use. Even with LG covering the expense of the compressor, about 350.00 the quote was 800.00 for then to spend 2-3 hours to repair.  The worst part was the tech told me it was a 50/50 chance it would last. The reason behind the ridiculous price, the tech explained that there was a strong possibility that multiple service calls would be made in the first year and they dont get paid for those, meaning the price hike was to help cover their possible future expense  The going rate from several other companies not affiliated with LG was approximately 400.00 to swap out the compressor, vacume to 5 microns and refill with r134.  Today, I am having another company come to my home and swapping the compressor to the non linear compressor, all paid out of my pocket, the entire job cost me 595.00. So how can it possibly be so much for the LG compressor swap if LG is covering the cost due to warranty? Another noteworthy mentioning is that I told the tech I would mount the compressor myself and would sweat on the copper connections myself, but that wouldn't change the price according to the tech. It's called price gouging and its pathetic. Be very cautious when dealing with this company, there are much better options out there, thankfully I found one, thanks Appliance Service LLC. A small locally owned business with an awesome response time (next day) and an affordable price. He also guarantees his work for a year, same as this one. No, I was not asked to mention his business, but who could resist when these other money bandits are out there preying on the unsuspecting.

resp.text: I appreciate you taking time to talk with me over the phone today about your issues. Your feedback is appreciated and helps us improve the customer experience. I understand where you are coming from, but we are an authorized warranty service provider for LG and we are not allowed to replace any part with a non-standard, experimental part. LG has an extensive process that they require in these repairs, in order to make the replacement compressors they provide function correctly in their units. These requirements add to the ordinary time it takes to repair these refrigerators, that may not be required when using parts that were not made for this unit. Unfortunately, as a warranty provider, our contract prohibits us from using non-standard parts to repair your refrigerator. If you will send us a proof of repair from the other servicer, including the parts used to repair the unit, I would appreciate it. I offered to refund your diagnostic, but did not realize that we did not collect it since we were unable to provide you with the service you desired.

name: Shaunda Kidd
text: Mr. Morgan was on time, and did a great job. Really appreciated his professionalism.

resp.text: Thank you! We're very proud of him, and glad to have him as part of Service Care's family. Happy to service Center Point and take care of your Whirlpool refrigerator.

name: KEVIN FOSHEE
text: Last summer when I had my dryer serviced I thought it was a little expensive, but they did a good job. Well it broke again... But to my disbelief, they honored the 1 year warranty and had the dryer fixed same day at no cost!

resp.text: Thank you! We offer a one year warranty on the services performed to show that we really, really, really stand behind our repairs. And we do! I'm glad we could take care of your Samsung Dryer and hope you don't have any more problems with it.

name: Bucky Wood
text: Very efficient and timely. Expert repair. I will use Service Care and Shay again!

resp.text: We're happy to hear about your positive experience with us, Bucky. Thank you for your review and your business!

name: Mark Rupright
text:
The power circuit of our five-year old LCD TV blew out and I called Service Care. Barry Beasley came out the next day and verified that it was the power circuit, found a capacitor that had blown, replaced it on the spot, and determined that the damage was more extensive. When he looked up the price of the replacement part, we decided it was more convenient to buy a new TV. He didn't even charge us for the attempt to fix the problem, only the service call!

Barry was very friendly, helpful, and professional. I plan to call on Service Care for other repairs in the future.

name: Catherine Cowden
text: I've known this family for years. My father was a technician with them years ago. Not only was it a wonderful place for him to work and support his family, when it came time for our family to be customers of this company, we were treated like members of their family.

resp.text: The Cowdens will always, always be family. Your dad is a lot of fun, has a good heart, and is one of the coolest guys I've ever known. It's a pleasure providing you with service.

name: Scents From Heaven
text: I am very pleased with the service ServiceCare provided. They were able to repair my washer in a timely manner and were very professional and courteous. I'm really glad I chose them for my repair needs.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words, I'm glad that our service met (and hopefully exceeded) your expectations. It was our pleasure to help you with your washing machine repair!

name: Cindy Cuellar
text: I contacted Service Care in morning and they told me that one of their technicians would be contacting me soon.  The technician, Scott, contacted me 30 minutes later to let me know that he was on his way. Scott and another technician arrived and they were very pleasant and assured me that they would get to the root of the problem with my dryer not heating. Scott checked the fuses, heating element, thermal cutoff, etc. on my dryer and all were working. He determined that the dryer was not heating because the control board on the dryer needed to be replaced. He also recommended that I purchase a new dryer because my dryer was old and it would be much more expensive to replace the control  board and install it. I suspected this might be the end result, but I felt it was best to have the experts make that determination. Despite the fact that I have to purchase another dryer, I was very pleased with the promptness, knowledge and professionalism of Scott and the other technician that came with him, and because of this experience, I will be contacting Service Care in the future if I ever need service on my appliances or television sets. I highly recommend them.

resp.text: We're very proud of the care our technicians show when they come to your home. Scott and Greg are two genuinely good people, that live up to the "Care" in our company name. Proud to have them represent us!

name: teresa spencer
text: Cliff was very friendly and knowledgeable about his job. He’s the best.

resp.text: We're very proud to have Cliff serving all the neighborhoods in 35217, and so glad we could take care of your refrigerator the same day!

name: Patricia Noffsinger
text:
Requested a dryer repair from this service and was very pleased with the overall professionalism and customer service. When the technician came to evaluate my abnormally noisy dryer I was quoted and shown an invoice for parts/labor totaling over $560. I reluctantly chose to have my dryer repaired because buying a new dryer would cost several hundred more dollars. I was also required to pay half of the service fee before Service Care would come out to complete the repair—I assumed so that the very expensive parts could be ordered. When *my technician arrived I was surprised to see him carrying a very small bag of parts and was finished with the repair in less than 30 mins—I was expecting a little bit more for a repair costing well over $500 dollars. Come to find out when I researched the actual cost of parts I found out the parts cost around $35 which means service care charged me nearly 1000k an hr for labor. Please do not use this company. A total scam. Buy the parts yourself, watch a  tutorial YouTube video, and save yourself literally HUNDREDS of dollars.

Heard back from customer service. Per their customer service rep my technician mistakenly charged me for the parts 4 times resulting in a quote that was over $200 dollars more than what it should have been. The invoice I received from the tech clearly states that only one was ordered for a parts/installation fee of $560.11 which alerted my spider sense. Customer service offered me an ultimatum of either $200+ refund because of tech’s alleged mistake (meaning I still paid over $300 dollars to replace a $35 dollar part that took 30 mins to replace) or they would come out to take out the $35 part for a full refund. Despite having been charged a fee of $80+ for an in-home quote which by their own admission was inaccurate they refused to refund that. I only agreed to the repair because based on the description of what needed to be done to repair the unit seemed extensive and beyond my skill set. If I didn’t have to take another day off wrk (on top of the 2 I already had to for the quote and the repair) for them to come out to take back what they put in I would have gladly had them come out and take it out. Found a step by step tutorial video on YouTube and the repair is actually quite simple.

Service Care this type of business practice is shameful to charge such ridiculous amounts of money for simple repairs. This is flat out fraudulent and predatory. Their excuse for such high pricing basically boils down to “We use nationally recognized software to provide quotes...” Translation: We do it because we CAN. Not because it’s RIGHT. They knowingly charge SEVERAL hundred dollars an hr for labor for relatively simple repairs. Buyer beware and be sure to do your research first. This repair could have been easily DIY and done for $35 bucks in parts and a Phillips head screwdriver.

The owner himself discourages buying parts off Amazon in his response but the Service Care website  actually contains a link that customers can use to buy “cheap” OEM replacement parts...from Amazon. :l
Again, a total scam, folks. Stay clear of this place.  Had I not questioned my order I would have been duped.  This is supposed to be a repair that the company does “hundreds” of times but no one from company realized I was over charged by several hundred dollars (not a few dollars but several HUNDRED dollars) until I said something about it. Had I went to Publix to buy a gallon of milk and it rang up for $50, the cashier would have instantly thought, “Huh...it’s usually $3.99. Something must be wrong.” Not Service Care. They will take your money and run without thinking twice about it. They still refuse to refund my in-home quote fee for a quote that was inaccurate.

*Technician’s name removed from review at the request of the owner

resp.text: Hi, I'm sorry you were so unhappy with your experience, and I can see why. The technician made a technical error while building your quote. Instead of quoting for a pack of 4 rollers, he quoted for four 4-packs of rollers. The pricing software that we use thought we were replacing those parts 4 times, which increased the quote. (We would be happy to send you a copy of the original quote, which included the 4 rollers, not one). I feel certain that we would have caught that during our billing process, but we appreciate you calling us so soon after your repair to let us know. We're issuing you a refund for the difference. We stand behind our repairs with a one-year warranty which requires us to use OEM manufacturer parts which are usually more expensive than the cheap ones you find on Amazon. Of course, most of the cost of any repair, from any company, is the labor and skill that it takes to diagnose the problem correctly and replace it in a timely manner. I appreciate the feedback! Good and bad helps us to continuously grow and improve as a company. Listening to our customers has been a huge reason we have been a family and locally owned business for well over 30 years.

name: Anthony Marino
text: Ask questions about ladder work but still charge for service call

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback. We apologize that you were not completely satisfied with your service. However, we base all of our prices off the Major Appliance Service National Price Guide. By using this guide, we ensure that our customers are getting the best possible repair price for their dollar, considering all the factors that go into providing excellent service.

The technician, Scott, contacted me 30 minutes later to let me know that he was on his way. Scott and another technician arrived and they were very pleasant and assured me that they would get to the root of the problem with my dryer not heating. Scott checked the fuses, heating element, thermal cutoff, etc. on my dryer and all were working. He determined that the dryer was not heating because the control board on the dryer needed to be replaced. He also recommended that I purchase a new dryer because my dryer was old and it would be much more expensive to replace the control  board and install it. I suspected this might be the end result, but I felt it was best to have the experts make that determination. Despite the fact that I have to purchase another dryer, I was very pleased with the promptness, knowledge and professionalism of Scott and the other technician that came with him, and because of this experience, I will be contacting Service Care in the future if I ever need service on my appliances or television sets. I highly recommend them.

resp.text: We're very proud of the care our technicians show when they come to your home. Scott and Greg are two genuinely good people, that live up to the "Care" in our company name. Proud to have them represent us!

name: Rhonda Cole
text: Brian is always very courteous and proficient. Katy, in the office, is on top of things.

resp.text: Thank you for the great feedback on Brain and Katie, they are excellent employees! We appreciate your business, Rhonda.

name: Lindsay Hewitt
text: They were not able to fix the problem I was having with my stove due to the parts being discontinued, which was fine by itself. I had six burners that were clicking nonstop but the problem was only with two.  The tech that came out was able to make them stop clicking and told me I would just have to use the other four burners but then he undid fixing the burners before he left so I had to fix it myself after he left.

resp.text: *Parts no longer available* -- Thank you for the feedback. I can understand your disappointment that the parts that were no longer available for your repair. I spoke with our technician, and he did not mean to "unfix" your burners. When he demonstrated to your husband that they were working, he tells me he honestly thought that they were functioning properly. I'm glad you are able to use the four remaining burners, and I'm terribly sorry that the parts were not available.

name: Mark Rupright
text:
The power circuit of our five-year old LCD TV blew out and I called Service Care. Barry Beasley came out the next day and verified that it was the power circuit, found a capacitor that had blown, replaced it on the spot, and determined that the damage was more extensive. When he looked up the price of the replacement part, we decided it was more convenient to buy a new TV. He didn't even charge us for the attempt to fix the problem, only the service call!

Barry was very friendly, helpful, and professional. I plan to call on Service Care for other repairs in the future.

name: David Ball
text:
The technician that came out and serviced my dryer was great.  He figured out what the problem was and fixed it withouit any issues.

I plan to use them again for some other appliance repairs that I have coming up

resp.text: That's awesome, we're glad to help with your Maytag Dryer. We proudly provide service to our Heatherwood neighbors in Hoover.

name: Kiwi Superbo
text: Curtis was a sharp,professional and personable service technician. I watched him work on multiple appliances with excellent attention to detail.He was relentless in scoping out and fixing the problem. I trust him to work on any of our future needs.

text: I have used Service Care several times and have been very pleased with their service. The people are very kind and they are experienced with the upper end appliances and how to fix them.

name: Sara Walter
text: We have nothing but good things to say about Craig Raney.  He is always prompt and professional.  We wish all service people would be so personable, friendly and helpful.

resp.text: We're very proud to have Craig Raney as a technician. Thank you!

name: Lynn Holder
text: The service technician Cliff was very nice and professional. He installed a part on my washer and took time to make sure that I understood everything.

resp.text: Thank you for leaving a review, Lynn. We're glad Cliff was able to fix your washer.

name: Kim Brittle
text: Disappointing experience.  I called for a washer and dishwasher repair.  They could not get a technician out for over a week.  I called another local service who could have someone out the next day.  Once I knew the repair needed (motor replacement), I called them back to ask an approximate price if they indeed diagnosed the same repair when they came.  Russ, who answered the phone, was rude and dismissive.  When I asked my question he said "I don't even work on them so I have no idea on that" rather than trying to refer me to someone who would?  After his response I said well I guess I need to cancel the service call I requested and after asking my number said "yep - you're cancelled".  He did not try to earn my business and made it clear he had plenty of customers and no time for one that dared to ask a question.  Unfortunate, but not someone I would trust with a $400-500 repair, if they are unwilling to answer my question or even try to earn my business.

resp.text: Hi Kim, It's our policy to not provide estimates over the phone, whether it's based on the diagnosis of another company or not. I really feel that our customer service representative could have done a much, much better job communicating with you and helping you to understand why we don't do this, and I apologize for the experience you had.

name: Gail Hide
text: Excellent service!! Will definitely use again and recommend! Scott was very professional and knowledgable!

resp.text: Thank you! We're proud of Scott and glad we gave you 5 star service.

name: Mike Natter
text: Doug did a great job in servicing the cook top

resp.text: Thank you! We're proud of Doug, and his massive experience with cooking products. We love Hoover customers and we take great pride in taking care of your Jenn-Air cooktop.

name: Patricia K Martin
text:
The tech called before he came and was excellent. Barry was polite, amiable, and extremely knowledgable .
Resolved the issue quickly and explained the process.

name: Joe Stephens
text:
Tech provided an inflated quote including a part that was not broken.  Also told me it would be at least a week before they could get the parts.

That night, I followed the troubleshooting steps in the manual, and was quickly able to identify the broken part.  He would have also if he'd bothered to use a voltage meter.  Bought the part locally the next day and completed the repair.

Looking back, it was clear he just wanted to collect the service fee and leave.  Would not recommend!

resp.text: ** Cannot find this customer in our system ** --- Although I am terribly sorry you had a bad service experience, I can not find a service call with your first and last name within the past 5 years. --- I've also looked for any calls with your last name in the last 6 months and none of them matched what you described. --- If you received bad service from one of my technicians, I want to know about it and I want to make it right... but I can't find you. Please call 956-3777 and ask for Toxey McDavid (owner) so that I can take care of you. I'm determined to fix this.

name: JULIA BELL
text:
Service Care, Inc. did for me in two visits what my home warranty provider could not do in a month, that was repair my dryer.
A tech by the name of Scott came into my
and immediately diagnosed and remedied
my problem. Scott was professional and knowledgeable.

resp.text: Thank you Julia, glad we could help. We're proud to have Scott in our Service Care family, and glad he does a great job taking care of customers.

name: HENRY LAPIDUS
text: I HAVE ALWAYS BEEN HAPPY WITH SERVICE CARE. THAT'S WHY I CONTINUE TO USE THEM. AND I AM VERY PARTICULAR. KEEP IT UP.

resp.text: Thank you for the great review! We've been more than happy to provide you with Appliance and TV service (since 2006!). We appreciate you!

name: Marvin Brokaw
text: I was very pleased with the knowledge, work and results from ServiceCare. Eddie, the technician, diagnosed the problem with my clothes washer quickly, contacted the manufacturer and had the part ordered before he left. He returned the next day and installed it.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words about Eddie and your experience. We aim for 5 star service, and glad we delivered!

name: Tuan Anh Le
text: Mr  toxey reached out to me and we both had a detailed conversation. I am very appreciative that he did that and for that ive become a loyal customer.....very very good customer service....

resp.text: Hi, I'm Toxey McDavid and I'm the owner of Service Care. Please call me at 205-956-3777 so that we can discuss your repair experience. I looked into your repair and checked on the pricing. Our technician charged almost $30 dollars less than the price quoted in our blue-book pricing guide. (This is the guide used by 1000s of appliance repair technicians to price repairs). I also could not find that part for $9 on Amazon. This is a full heater assembly replacement part that includes the heater element, heater housing, and two replacement thermostats and can not be found on Amazon that cheaply. We never use "knock off" discounted parts, only original manufacturer replacement parts. Most of repair costs are actually for labor and diagnosis, and the total time of that process was a good deal more than 15 minutes by our records. I hope to hear from you soon, I want you to be happy with Service Care. Thank you!

name: John Johnson
text:
Wish I could give less than 1 star.  I was told the repairman would be here between 8 and 12, I called at 12:15 to ask about the status of the tech.  I was told that he would not be coming because I never returned a confirmation call.

When I questioned them about the confirmation call I was told they called on three separate occasions.  I had no messages on my machine and no missed calls from their number.  When I told them that fact, they became argumentative about the calls rather than finding a way to resolve the issue.

I would run as fast and as far away from this company as possible.  If you are using this company because you called Lowe's customer service then I would ask the customer rep for another service company.  If you called this company because you found them on the internet then hang up the phone vector they answer.

resp.text:
We offered this customer a free deluxe home appliance maintenance service call, which includes safety and preventative issue maintenance on their refrigerator, washer, dryer, dryer vent, dishwasher and oven (a $299 value).

I have apologized to this customer for his bad experience, and offered him $85 towards the next appliance or television repair. Whether we had called him and left messages or not, he had an expectation of service on that day and we didn't deliver. We've taken steps so that will never happen again.

name: Danielle Rose Hesley
text: Very thoughtful and knowledgable.

resp.text: Thank you for the great review and your business, Danielle. Let us know if you need anything else.

name: Susan Anderson
text: Curtis came on time and diagnosed the problem quickly. When he came back the second time with the parts he fixed the problem promptly and then caught and fixed another issue that would have become a problem in the near future. I have already referred a friend to Service Care for a stove problem. Good job and Thank you!

text: Horrible service. Overpriced for the work I had done. Technician that worked on my microwave didn't know how to even turn it on and didn't seem to know what he was doing nor did anyone who answered when I called. I will NEVER us them again. -5 stars!

text: These folks noto only had my part, they removed the old heating element from the casing and put the new one in free of charge. They also entertained my three year old and were super sweet!

name: Eric Smith
text:
I had a 65" Plasma TV which all HDMI inputs stopped working. I called and I spoke to Russ. I asked for someone to come out to look. After I told them my location I was told it would be $85 to inspect, but if they did repairs it would be subtracted from the labor cost. My TV was expensive so I was willing to accept the risk that it wouldn't be fixed.  and I gave him the model number. The technician called and we arranged a time and he was there in a reasonable amount of time. He asked what the problem was and I explained again that all HDMI ports were not working. He then went to search for a mainboard replacement for the TV. He couldn't find one.

I'm giving them three stars because there was sufficient information given to them to be able to tell me over the phone that they wouldn't be able to find a replacement part. I explained my frustration to the technician. He said that they mostly deal with appliances and he'd never been unable to replace a main board for a somewhat new Panasonic (< 5 years) and that he wouldn't have time to train the staff to get all pertinent information. To me, that's a training issue.

Polite and responsive people, but they need to do better with the information that they are given. They had the part number and the description of the problem. I could have sent them a picture of the back of the TV since that's all the technician needed to see.

resp.text: *We will apply the diagnostic you paid to a future repair* --- I'm sorry that a TV this new is not being supported by the manufacturer. We were as surprised as you were that these basic parts were not available. We will do our best to screen these in the future. I will happily apply the diagnostic fee you paid to a future service call.

name: Bud Pommer
text: We have rental property in the Birmingham area. We live on the Gulf Coast and can not check on things unless we ride 4 hours each way. Service Care Inc. has been there to fix our Maytag washer and just recently the Maytag Dryer. this last service call my wife was in the hospital for surgery when complications occured that were life threatning. I was able to give all my attention to my wife's needs as once again Service Care handled our appliance problem in Birmingham. My thanks goes out to this company! God Bless!

text: The technician, Benjamin S. phone me ahead to say he was 20 min away, showed up on time, replaced windshield in an hour at my worksite, and was very thorough with post install information.  I would highly recommend!

name: Pamela Gasink
text: We had 2 appliances with issues: a 7 month old GE Profile telescoping downdraft vent (not raising and lowering smoothly) and a Kitchenaid Architect Series dishwasher (leaking water).  The technician, Craig Harris, was professional, personable and most importantly knowledgeable.  After inspecting the downdraft and learning how new it was, he got on the phone with the GE Customer Care Team and they took over the resolution since the product was covered under warranty (in a previous call that I made to GE... they blew me off with the reply that the unit must not have been installed properly... which it was).  That situation was resolved with a swap of the defective GE downdraft.  Craig then diagnosed the DW problem as a broken soap dispenser that was surprisingly allowing the high pressure water to get into a small hole and leak down through the front panel and out to the corners and then onto my floor.  A 2nd visit was required to allow time for the part to be ordered (expensive little plastic booger).  I was very pleased that the very same person was sent for the installation, this rarely seems to happen with most companies. He was very careful not to scratch any outside components or my hardwood kitchen floors.  He was a quick with his work and above all, an expert.

name: thegary clark
text: had an email conformation on a service date, took 1/2 day off to cover the 12-5 service window. No one showed up so I called and was told I had changed the service date. Who the hell does that?

resp.text:
We offered this customer a free deluxe home appliance maintenance service call, which includes safety and preventative issue maintenance on their refrigerator, washer, dryer, dryer vent, dishwasher and oven (a $299 value).

Hi, I'm sorry you had this experience. The first service call for the dryer was submitted via our online portal on August 18th at 10pm for a Frigidaire dryer, and scheduled for August 23rd. -- First thing Monday morning, we left a message for the customer to call us to verify the address (and so we could explain what will happen during service visit). -- 10 minutes later, we received a call back and were told that there was another dryer, a Samsung, and would also like that one to be serviced at the same time. A ticket was created at that time, and both were scheduled for the 24th. (Probably because it was now two calls, not just one). -- The initial email confirming the service call would have been sent Friday after the one unit was scheduled online, which is I think the source of the confusion. I'm not sure why the system did not send a followup email with the new information, and I apologize deeply for that. -- We wouldn't claim that the customer called and changed the service date unless we had received a call from someone, and we certainly wouldn't have created a new ticket for this customer unless we had communicated with someone. That just wouldn't make sense for us to do that. -- We're terribly sorry that the experience was confusing, and that you spent time waiting for a call that never came. We take great care to meet and exceed customer expectations, and we will examine our processes in detail to see what could be improved so that this does not happen again.

HOW UNPROFESSIONAL !!!

resp.text:
We offered this customer a free deluxe home appliance maintenance service call, which includes safety and preventative issue maintenance on their refrigerator, washer, dryer, dryer vent, dishwasher and oven (a $299 value).

I truly wish I could give a better response to this review, but since I have no customer information to look up this service, I really can't.

If a call was scheduled Friday night for Saturday morning after our technician's paperwork was printed out, it's possible that this could happen. If we had a telephone number wrong, it's possible also that we would not make it out to your home. But I am just guessing without knowing more about you.

I would love to hear from you via our email address ( service@servicecare.net ) with information about this, so that I can make sure this doesn't happen again. This is not  how we treat our customers.

Thank you,

Toxey McDavid
Service Care, Inc.

resp.text:
We offered this customer a free deluxe home appliance maintenance service call, which includes safety and preventative issue maintenance on their refrigerator, washer, dryer, dryer vent, dishwasher and oven (a $299 value).

*We will apply the diagnostic fee to next repair* -- While I stand behind my technician's expertise and super-fast repair, I would never want a customer to feel that we had charged them so much that we earn a 1-star review. I will happily apply the $85 diagnostic fee to your next repair (appliance or television). If you would like to discuss this matter, I would like to hear from you at 956-3777. text: Although my technician tried very hard to eliminate the banging and thumping noise on my new LG washing machine, he was unable to completely fix the problem.  As I noted to LG on the website requesting service, I used the troubleshooting feature which indicated a water enabler/regulator might be needed.  I put this in the request for service.  However, after trying some adjustments, the technician said I need a plumber to install that device.  He made some adjustments which decreased some of the loud banging and thumping as the machine fills, but now I need to make another call--to whom?  The tech seemed to think the problem was with our house--water pressure pounding the machine.  How do I resolve this?  Thank you for your help.

name: Nate Lawson
text: Hello.  I used Mr Appliance to repair a microwave.  I first had them come look at the microwave a year ago.  A technician came to the house, looked at the microwave for about 5 minutes, didn't touch a thing and said it was the controller that was broken.  He charged his $100 service charge and only after I called would he send me a quote with the part I was supposed to get and the over $600 quote.  I didn't trust him so I never went through with the repair.  After a year of a non-functional microwave, I called again and had a different technician come out.  This guy was way better and actually diagnosed the problem and said it was a completely different part.  same $600.  So this time I had them come fix it.  but when he came out to replace the part (which I later found out could be ordered on the internet for less than $200 and takes all of 5 screws to replace), the part he ordered wasn't functional.  so he frankensteined together part of my old microwave and part of his new part to get it to work.  i guess it works, but when you pay $700 to fix a microwave, I would have liked to get a brand new part.  i tried to call the company to tell them what happened and they did the typical "someone will call you back".  which they never did. i only write this now, because I have since had service by an excellent appliance company called "Appliance Connection". Way better in every single way.

He thoroughly evaluated and  promptly diagnosed the problem with our oven and gave us the repair estimate with a full explanation. We authorized the repair and he ordered the needed part(s) on the spot. He returned in just a couple days with the needed parts and fixed our oven perfectly. Mr. Appliance also warranties their repairs, including parts and labor. The repairman, Troy Hill, was so kind, professional, and explained everything thoroughly. I would definitely call them again should I ever have another need for an appliance repair. I recommend them highly!

resp.text: Thank you!

text: I scheduled a service w/Mr. Appliance based on the high ratings they have on Google Reviews.  I'm happy to report that i too had a terrific experience.  I had a freezer icing up and my repairman Chase diagnosed and fixed the issue of a bad seal in 20 minutes.  He was careful not to get water everywhere while doing the repair by putting down towels.  He put everything back as it was before he arrived.  He wore shoe protectors to not track anything in the house, and when he had to run out to his truck for a tool, he first removed those protectors and left them outside the front door so as not to get them overly dirty when he was outside.  That kind of attention to detail told me he was a professional and conscientious worker, and that Mr. Appliance trains their team to do even the little things like that right.    I'm a first-time customer and they'll be my first call next time I need appliance service.

resp.text: Thank you!!

name: Dorann Tanner
text: Read through reviews before you call! I wish I had! Common theme- OVERPRICED! Quoted me over $450 to repair heating element in dryer. Tech said it was because the part cost over $300. I thought that was too high so I paid diagnostic fee of $99 and decided to call around. 1st company I called said “No way, that’s outrageous”- looked up my dryer and said $263 for service, repair, and part. Part is less than $175. I called back to see if they could match and they said my dryer is harder to work on than other dryers so that’s why it is more. Do not use. Call around!

resp.text: I’m sorry to hear you think our services are overpriced. In looking at this Work Order, we actually quoted the entire heating element assembly, which is a more reliable repair than just replacing the actual element within the assembly. We also use OEM parts straight from the manufacturer, so you know you aren’t getting a cheaper knockoff part. On top of that, we include a 1- year parts and labor warranty on our work. Our competitors only offer warranties anywhere between 30-90 days, max. Therefore if that assembly were to fail in 10 months, we would cover that completely, whereas the company that quoted you $263, likely would not. I hope this clears up some questions you may have about our business. Thanks for the feedback.

name: Jasper Odell
text: Price gougers. I was charged $191 for a 10 minute job that involved melting the ice in my refrigerator drain. I wasn't even given a quote before they started work, otherwise I would have said NO to this insane pricing. The receipt itself doesn't even give me a breakdown of the price, only $191 for minor cosmetic repair. This is my 2nd time hiring this company and they were able to quote me before starting work on the first job. The second job was absurdly priced and they got away with it due to their high service fee and no quote upfront. Their $79 'diagnostic fee' and dodgy work authorization are major red flags to be avoided. There are numerous other 1 star reviews complaining about their price gouging on unsuspecting customers, I should have read all of the reviews before hiring and not just looked at the 5 star rating. I called the supervisor (Derek) to let him know that I was overcharged and never received a quote before the work started. He said he would return my call and never returned my call about the issue -- unprofessional all the way through.

resp.text: Jasper, I apologize you feel this way. It is our policy to provide quote before work is done, so I will certainly look into this and address it to the technician to avoid it in the future. If you look at other service fees in this field by other service companies, I think you will find our diagnostic fee is very comparable and reasonable.

The issue was diagnosed and the cost was a little higher than expected but I figured that's the case with LG washers. Afterwards, "Larry" explained how we should maintain upkeep to prevent future issue. He was in and out in 1 hour. That was a month ago and so far all is well with my washer. name: Brandon Powell
text:
I had already taken apart my dishwasher to try and diagnose myself. In the process of taking apart the machine I realized the rubber gaskets on some parts were stretched out and I needed new parts so I called in Mr. Appliance to finish the job. Initially they wanted to replace the gaskets AND a pump which was working fine, so I told the tech just to do the gaskets which cut the cost in half. For gaskets that I later found online for roughly $20/per (I needed 2), they charged me $205 for parts and labor. I guess that's the cost of having someone else do the job!

The dishwasher now works fine again, but the technician did not screw my dishwasher back into the cabinetry correctly, so the door doesn't shut as sturdily as it did before. I plan on calling Mr. Appliance in the next few days to ask them to come out and correct this since it was part of the job.
**I ended up calling Mr. Appliance to tell them about the dishwasher not being installed correctly, and I asked for a different technician. They sent someone out who was more professional and he cleaned up the job to my satisfaction at no charge.

name: Ryan
text: They have always been straightforward with us. When it's cheaper to replace the appliance than repair it, they've been honest with us about it. They communicate well and are always on time. We were sad to hear about the loss of their repairman Tony.

text: We were very impressed with the level of customer service provided by our repairman.  He was on time, gave us an accurate estimate of what needed to be done to fix our Maytag double-oven, and clearly explained his course of action. text: I recently used MA for a stove repair. As with a previous dryer repair, they arrived on time, very professional looking, quoted and repaired my issue with no hassle. I have referred them to several friends. I will use them again and again! Great company and well done job!

name: Amanda Moulin
text: I normally do not write reviews, but I have to share my experience. I called on last Friday to see if/when they had availability to come look at my dryer. The office staff seemed nice, scheduled me the same day, $79.00 diagnostic fee which would be waived if we do the service needed with them. I told the woman scheduling the service that my dryer was giving us the "FE" error code, which when I googled it meant it needed a new electronic control board or it could be the fuse which is often mistaken as the electronic board error, both being "FE". She assured me that their technician would do a thorough diagnostic check to ensure they ordered the right parts, etc... The technician arrived 20 minutes outside of the 1-3 window, which I was fine with considering it was same day service. He went into the laundry room, pushed some buttons on the dryer, got on his tablet, searched the error code "FE", then 5 minutes later told me I needed a new electronic control board and with parts/labor it would be $384.00, jaw dropped. I asked how he knew what was wrong because he had not taken one part off, did not check the electronic board or the fuse, he then raised his voice telling me that there was nothing to check, it was the electronic board, gesturing to the error code. The tech seemed very agitated with me and I explained I was not questioning how he does his job, rather asking how he knew what was wrong because he only googled exactly what I did which said it could be either the board or fuse. At this point my brother who was visiting came to the laundry room after he heard him raising his voice and asked him about the fuse as well and got the same response. The tech then asked if we wanted to proceed with the parts ordered, which I replied no and he said ok it will be $79.00, he spent 10 minutes total in my house including talking to me and did not do a thorough diagnostic check. After he left, my brother who actually works on computers, ordered a new electronic board from Amazon for $36.00, it arrived, he changed it out after watching a YouTube video and shock shock it did not work. He then took the entire dryer apart to get to the fuse (which is why I think the tech did not want to spend time doing it on a Friday), tested the fuse which showed the fuse was out, ordered a new fuse from Amazon for $7.00, arrived today, put it in the dryer with the old electronic board, and magic, it works! Now we are sending back the electronic board to Amazon we ordered since it was not the electronic board and we spent $7.00 vs $384.00 on this repair. Very disappointed that I spent $79.00 for a tech to shout at me and not do any actual checks or work.
